verses.verse: The Futility of Idols and the Trustworthiness of God Not ((Is. 48:11); Ezek. 36:32) unto us, O LORD, not unto us, But to Your name give glory, Because of Your mercy, Because of Your truth.
Why should the Gentiles say, (Ps. 42:3, 10) “So where is their God?”
((1 Chr. 16:26)) But our God is in heaven; He does whatever He pleases.
(Deut. 4:28; 2 Kin. 19:18; Is. 37:19; 44:10, 20; Jer. 10:3) Their idols are silver and gold, The work of men’s hands.
They have mouths, but they do not speak; Eyes they have, but they do not see;
They have ears, but they do not hear; Noses they have, but they do not smell;
They have hands, but they do not handle; Feet they have, but they do not walk; Nor do they mutter through their throat.
(Ps. 135:18; Is. 44:9-11) Those who make them are like them; So is everyone who trusts in them.
(Ps. 118:2, 3) O Israel, trust in the LORD; (Ps. 33:20) He is their help and their shield.
O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD; He is their help and their shield.
You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD; He is their help and their shield.
The LORD has been mindful of us; He will bless us; He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.
(Ps. 128:1, 4) He will bless those who fear the LORD, Both small and great.
May the LORD give you increase more and more, You and your children.
May you be ((Gen. 14:19)) blessed by the LORD, (Gen. 1:1; Acts 14:15; Rev. 14:7) Who made heaven and earth.
The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD’s; But the earth He has given to the children of men.
(Ps. 6:5; 88:10-12; (Is. 38:18)) The dead do not praise the LORD, Nor any who go down into silence.
(Ps. 113:2; Dan. 2:20) But we will bless the LORD From this time forth and forevermore. Praise the LORD!
